title: Bug 13725 - Revert is much slower than close and reopen in Java editor
description: Bug 13725 - Revert is much slower than close and reopen in Java editor.
OB: When I answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog and then double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it, the contents of the window are replaced with the original almost instantly. However, if I repeat the steps of answering 'no' to the dialog and double-clicking on the file, and then select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
SR: To reproduce the issue: 1. Open a file in the Java editor. 2. Make some changes to the file. 3. When prompted to save changes, choose 'no'. 4. Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it. 5. Observe that the contents of the window are replaced instantly. 6. Repeat steps 3 and 4. 7. Right-click on the editor and choose 'Revert' from the pop-up menu. 8. Observe that it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
